title: Environmental Interactions and Ecosystems

vocab.definition: All living and non-living things in an environment and how they interact
A complex network showing how energy flows through multiple food chains
An animal that hunts and eats other animals
An animal that is hunted and eaten by other animals
A characteristic that helps an organism survive in its environment
A nonliving part of an ecosystem, like sunlight or water
A living part of an ecosystem, like plants and animals
An organism's role and place in its environment
A close relationship between two species that live together
A symbiotic relationship where both species benefit
A symbiotic relationship where one benefits and the other is not harmed
A symbiotic relationship where one benefits and the other is harmed

teachingNotes: Explore complex relationships in ecosystems. Discuss how changes in one part affect the whole system. Study adaptations that help organisms survive in different environments.

sample.question: How is a food web different from a food chain?
Give an example of a structural adaptation.
Give an example of a behavioral adaptation.
What happens if prey increases a lot?

truefalse.question: If one species disappears, it can affect many others.
Producers get energy from eating other organisms.
Decomposers return nutrients to the soil.
Food webs show many pathways of energy.
Camouflage can help animals avoid predators.
Removing predators always helps prey long-term.

multiplechoice.question: What is an example of an adaptation?
Which shows energy flow in an ecosystem?
If producers decrease, what might happen?
What adds nutrients back to soil?

fillintheblank.question: In a predator-prey relationship, the hawk is the ________ and the mouse is the ________.
Organisms that make their own food are ________.
Organisms that break down dead matter are ________.
A trait that helps survival is an ________.
A network of connected food chains is a ________.
Variety of life in an area is ________.
Animals that eat other animals are ________.
Returning nutrients to soil is ________ role.

shortanswer.question: What might happen to an ecosystem if all predators were removed?
Explain how a food web shows energy flow.
expectedAny: arrows show energy from producers to consumers
energy moves from plants to animals

shortanswer.question: Give one structural and one behavioral adaptation.
How can pollution affect an ecosystem?
How might a drought affect a food web?
What happens if an invasive species is introduced?
Give one way humans can help ecosystems.
